name: Fed Rate Decision Impact
description: Federal Reserve announces surprise rate cut, triggering cascading effects across financial markets

event_data.event_headline: Fed cuts rates by 0.5%, markets react instantly
event_data.impact_thesis: Lower rates reduce borrowing costs, boosting stocks and crypto while weakening dollar. Historical data shows crypto typically gains 10-20% within weeks of rate cuts

primary_effects.reason: Rate cuts directly weaken dollar by reducing yield differential
Lower Fed rates compress long-term yields immediately

secondary_effects.reason: Weaker dollar makes crypto attractive; historical pattern from 2020-2021
Tech stocks benefit from lower discount rates; P/E expansion likely
Gold rallies on dollar weakness and inflation hedge demand

tertiary_effects.reason: Lower rates improve IPO market conditions; startups accelerate public plans
Lower mortgage rates stimulate housing sector with 3-6 month lag

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Rate cuts happen BECAUSE inflation is contained. Market overpricing inflation risk

contrarian_takes: Market may overreact to tech stocks - not all benefit equally from rate cuts
Bitcoin could disappoint if institutional adoption slows despite favorable macro

cascade_chains.chain: Fed Rate → Dollar → Crypto → Tech Stocks → IPO Market
cascade_chains.rationale: Lower rates weaken dollar, making crypto attractive, boosting tech valuations, improving IPO conditions

cascade_chains.chain: Fed Rate → Yields → Housing → Construction → Materials
cascade_chains.rationale: Rate cuts lower mortgage rates, stimulating housing demand and construction sector

market_impact_forecast.reason: Lower rates historically bullish for crypto
Tech stocks benefit from lower discount rates

key_risks: Inflation concerns could reverse sentiment within days
Regulatory changes could dampen crypto rally
Recession fears may offset rate cut optimism
event_data.educational_takeaway: Interest rates affect asset prices through discount rate mechanism and create multi-stage cascades across asset classes

name: AI Breakthrough Announcement
description: Major tech company announces GPT-5 level breakthrough in AI capabilities

event_data.event_headline: GPT-5 class model demonstrates near-AGI reasoning abilities
event_data.impact_thesis: Advanced AI capabilities accelerate across tech sector, affecting valuations and regulatory outlook. Historical pattern: initial euphoria followed by regulatory scrutiny

primary_effects.reason: Direct beneficiary of breakthrough; validates astronomical valuation
Hardware providers benefit immediately from increased AI compute demand

secondary_effects.market_name: AI startup funding up 30%+ in Q1
secondary_effects.reason: Breakthrough validates AI sector; VCs accelerate deployment
Enterprise adoption accelerates; Microsoft OpenAI partnership benefits

tertiary_effects.reason: Advanced capabilities trigger regulatory urgency; EU AI Act precedent
Companies accelerate AI adoption to reduce costs; GPT-5 replaces more roles

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Even GPT-5 breakthrough doesn't equal AGI. Market conflating capability improvement with full AGI

contrarian_takes: Traditional tech stocks may underperform - value accrues to AI-native companies
Regulation may come faster than market expects, creating volatility

cascade_chains.chain: AI Breakthrough → Tech Stocks → Cloud Revenue → Enterprise Software → Job Market
cascade_chains.rationale: Breakthrough drives tech rally, increases cloud adoption, transforms enterprise software, impacts employment

key_risks: Breakthrough capabilities may be exaggerated in initial demos
Regulatory backlash could accelerate faster than expected
Competitive response from Meta/Google could limit OpenAI gains
event_data.educational_takeaway: Technology breakthroughs create multi-stage market cascades with regulatory backlash as a common tertiary effect

name: Election Poll Shift
description: Surprise polling shift in key swing states ahead of presidential election

event_data.event_headline: Polling shows unexpected 5-point swing toward Republican in PA, MI, WI
event_data.impact_thesis: Electoral probabilities shift dramatically, affecting policy-sensitive markets and sector rotations

primary_effects.reason: Swing state polls are leading indicators; 5-point shift is statistically significant

secondary_effects.reason: Republican platform less favorable to renewable subsidies
Republican administration typically more fossil fuel friendly

tertiary_effects.reason: Republican control increases odds of healthcare policy changes

arbitrage_opportunities.reasoning: Swing state shifts suggest close race, not landslide. Market overreacting

contrarian_takes: Polling error remains high - 2016/2020 taught markets to be skeptical
Late campaign developments could easily reverse this trend

cascade_chains.chain: Poll Shift → Election Odds → Policy Markets → Sector Rotation → Stock Picks
cascade_chains.rationale: Different candidates favor different policies and sectors; markets price in new regime

market_impact_forecast.reason: Republican candidate less favorable to renewables

key_risks: Polling error remains significant (3-4 points typical)
Late campaign events (debates, scandals) could reverse trend
Early voting data may contradict polls
event_data.educational_takeaway: Political events cascade through policy expectations to market sectors, with timing based on election proximity
